item.title: Remembering People
item.description: When I came out of depression at age eighteen, I felt like a completely different person. It was like I’d waken up for the first time. The world seemed so vivid and deliberate, where before it was a clouded movie I couldn’t really keep up with. That’s how I remember experiencing life, as though I was sitting in a film theatre watching the world happen through my eyes while having absolutely no control over what was going to occur next.
